Dear Megan Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the Program Manager, Claudia Triestram.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two Youth on the same wing gained access to cleaning products
and ingested the cleaning product on separate occasions.
Investigation This investigation was assigned on 6/1/23 and was completed in
collaboration with the Government Worker.
The allegations are:
Youth S (15) resides at Vista Maria in the DeRoy building. On
05/26/2023 around 6:30pm, Youth S and other unknown youths
gained access to cleaning products within the facility. Youth S and
the other youths ingested the cleaning products, which was a
premeditated plan. Youth S was found lying on the ground having
difficulty breathing after she ingested the products. Youth S was
transported to Garden City Hospital, where she was evaluated for
her physical and mental health. It was recommended that Youth S
be admitted to an inpatient psychiatric care, but they were not able
to find a bed for her. Youth S was released from the hospital and
sent back to Vista Maria on 05/31/2023. Youth S is on observation
at the facility, but there is a high concern for her mental health. It is
not believed that Youth S was released with any additional mental
health resources, and there is also concern how she was able to
access the cleaning products. Youth S is already high risk for
suicidal ideations and self-harm.
2

I interviewed Youth S face to face at the facility in collaboration
with the Government Worker on 6/2/23. Youth S is in the 9th
grade and is 15 years old. Youth S reported she was feeling
down and upset after a visit with her worker who reported to her
that they could not locate a foster home for her due to behaviors
and that she would be at Vista until she was 19 years old. Youth
S reported she has been at Vista for 2 years and feels stuck.
Youth S reported she took a bottle of cleaning solution from the
hallway closet and took it to her room and drank ½ the bottle as
she wanted to kill herself. Youth S reported Youth M saw her
ingest the solution and took the bottle from her and got staff.
Youth S report that Youth Worker D came to her room and Nurse
H came and checked on her before she was transported by
ambulance to Garden City Hospital. Youth S reported she took the
cleaning solution from the hallway cleaning supply closet that is
supposed to be locked at all times. The closet was not locked so
she was able to grab the bottle and take it to her room. Youth S
was at the hospital for four days with Vista staffing there. Youth S
reported they she was unable to shower due to the hospital not
having enough staffing.
After four days at the hospital Youth S reported she lied about no
longer feeling suicidal and was ready to come back to the facility
as she had a plan to AWOL. Youth S reported that Supervisor F
and Youth Worker C transported her back to the facility. Youth
Worker S reported she got out of the car on Vista property and
attempted to run and Youth Worker C grabbed her around the
waist and stopped her and then Supervisor F and Youth Worker C
transported her into the building. Youth S reported she was very
upset and was crying, wheezing and felt like nobody was
supporting her. She reported requesting water and her inhaler
and that nobody gave it to her. Youth S reported she started
throwing books, punching at staff, and that Supervisor F called her
a “slow ass kid” and told her she “stank”. Youth S reported
having several bruises from the incident the evening she returned.
Youth S reported Supervisor F slammed her head against the
wall. Youth S reported she was given water and she drank it and
then spit in the cup and threw it on Supervisor F. Youth S reported
she took the sanitizer gel off the wall and drank some of it and
attempted to suck the liquid out of alcohol wipes that evening.
Youth S reported she coughed really bad from doing this. Youth S
reported she got a metal spring off the ground and placed it in her
bra and Supervisor F said she had a weapon, and he would
restrain her to get it. Youth S reported she was restrained by
Supervisor F and Supervisor O and a female staff removed the
3

metal item from her shirt. Youth S reported she pulled the strip off
the side of the table and wrapped it around her neck, and she took
a piece of metal and tried cutting her wrist with it. Both items were
taken from her by staff.
I interviewed Youth M at the facility on 6/2/23 face to face with the
Government Worker. Youth M reported she is 17 years old. She
reported she saw Youth S grab the solution and take it to her
room. Youth M reported she went into the room and saw Youth S
down the bottle of solution and drop the bottle. Youth M reported
she picked up the bottle and put the top back on and put it back in
the closet and got staff for help. Youth M reported Youth S was
lying on the floor choking and the nurse forced Youth S to sit up
when she arrived. Youth M reported she brought Youth S water,
and they waited one and half hours for an ambulance. Youth M
reported the staff working were Supervisor F, Youth Worker D and
Youth Worker C. Youth M reported that Supervisor F slammed
Youth S’ head into the wall when she returned from the hospital.
Youth M denied seeing it but reported she heard it.
Youth M reported Youth D drank widow spray a few days after
Youth S and was taken to the hospital. Youth D got the window
spray from the towel closet that was not locked but should have
been locked as unopened cleaning products are also kept in that
closet. Youth D was taken to Garden City Hospital after drinking
the window cleaner solution.
I interviewed Youth Worker D on 6/2/23 face to face at the facility
with the Government Worker. She reported she has been
employed at Vista for the past two months working the afternoon
shift. Youth Worker D reported that she had the three girls from
her wing (Youth S, Youth M and Youth D) at the park on campus
and all seemed fine with them. A campus clear was called when
they were at the park, so they had to return to the wing. Youth are
required to be in their rooms during a campus clear and if youth
are in their room, you do not have to be in line of sight of them at
all times. Youth Worker D reported she was at the desk and
Supervisor F was in his office and they heard gasping breathing
and Youth M saying “I told you not to do it “ over and over. Youth
Worker D reported she went down the hall and Youth S was sitting
on the floor just outside her bedroom and then was laying on the
floor coughing and gasping for air. Youth Worker D reported she
believes Youth S drank TB, a disinfectant solution. She reported
Supervisor F had to ask Youth M a few times what Youth S drank
and to get him the bottle and then he called poison control and the
campus nurse and someone else called an ambulance. Youth
4

Worker D reported she went to the hospital in a campus car to be
with Youth and did an incident report that night. Youth Worker D
reported the closet is supposed to be locked at all times and they
do a security check when they change shifts about 3-3:20pm.
She reported she did the closet check, and it was locked at shift
change. Youth Worker D reported the residents are not allowed to
handle the chemical/cleaning solutions ever and they spray them
for them when they need to use them. Youth Worker D reported
she was not at the facility upon Youth S’ return to campus.
I interviewed Youth Worker C on 6/2/23 face to face at the facility
with the Government Worker. Youth Worker C reported she has
been employed with Vista for the past 9 months and works flex
shift. Youth Worker C reported she was working when Youth S
drank the cleaning solution. She reported she was upfront talking
with staff and heard loud talking and then saw Supervisor F go to
see what happened and then returned with a bottle of cleaning
solution and said, “she drank it”. Youth Worker C indicated Youth
S was given some water and was outside her room and was
laying on her side on the floor rolling around saying “I cannot do
this anymore”. Youth Worker C reported that Nurse H came and
asked what poison control said and then EMS came and got
Youth S. Youth Worker C denied writing an incident report.
Youth Worker C reported she went with Supervisor F to pick up
Youth S from the hospital about 7:30pm and Youth S seemed fine
and was apologetic to them about the situation. Youth S got into
the car willingly and they arrived back to Vista about 8:15pm.
Youth Worker C rode in the back of the car with Youth S and
Supervisor F let Youth Worker C out of the car when they arrived
and Youth Worker C let out Youth S. Youth S tried to run when let
out of the car. Youth Worker C reported she grabbed Youth S’
waist and arm for a two-person restraint and Supervisor F got the
other arm. Youth Worker C reported they restrained her for four
minutes and then escorted her into the building. Youth Worker C
reported she had Youth S’ arm under her arm, and she had a hold
of Youth S’ wrist on the right side and Supervisor F was on the left
side. Youth Worker C said they let go of Youth S once inside
green wing and Youth S began to flip the couch, chairs, computer
desks, was throwing stuff and she assault Supervisor F 2-3 times.
Youth Worker C reported she and Supervisor F restrained Youth
S again after she assaulted Supervisor F. Youth Worker C
reported they were standing for the restraint, and it lasted about 1
minutes. Youth Worker C reported the restraint was done against
the wall as they were standing by the wall. Youth Worker C denied
5

that Supervisor F put Youth S’ head on the wall or slammed it on
the wall.
Youth Worker C reported Youth S pulled the fire alarm a couple of
times during that night and the fire alarm rang for quite some time.
Youth Worker C denied hearing Supervisor F tell Youth S she was
a slow ass kid or that she stank. Youth Worker C reported that
Youth S got into Supervisor F’s personal space several times and
she never heard him say you better get off me. Youth Worker C
did not see Youth S ingest sanitizer or wrap something around her
neck. She reported she saw Youth S tear down the window
treatments and proceeded to try and cut herself with the metal that
came out of the wall from the window treatment. Youth Worker C
reported she felt Youth S was experiencing suicidal ideation that
night after she was stopped from going AWOL. Youth Worker C
reported the nurse was called and Youth S was given water and
her inhaler. Youth S was put on 100% supervision that evening
due to her behaviors. Youth Worker C reported Youth S was given
water and she drank it, and the cup was refilled for her, and she
spit in it and threw the cup with water and spit on Supervisor F.
She reported additional staff were called to the unit during this
incident to assist. Youth S’ therapist and staff psychologist were
also called. Youth Worker C reported that Supervisor F was
unable to remove himself from the incident or wing as a male
couldn’t go work in another wing in the building alone with female
youth.
I interviewed Team Leader JJ who reported working afternoons
Tuesday-Saturday. She reported the supply closets are to be
locked at all times and they are never to give cleaning
supplies/solutions/chemicals to the youth to use. She reported
they do security checks each shift and check to ensure the supply
closets are locked. She reported nobody saw Youth S drink the
solution. Team Leader JJ was working the evening Youth S
returned from the hospital. She reported she was passing meds
and heard Youth S saying, “let me the fuck go” and was tussling
with staff while they were escorting her. She reported Youth S was
cussing at everyone and crying and she never heard Youth S say
she was having an asthma attack or that she was begging for
water. Team Leader JJ reported that Youth S was saying she
wanted to kill herself and was telling other staff to not talk to her
and was assaulting Supervisor F. Team Leader JJ reported she
didn’t see Youth S harm herself and Youth S kept pulling the fire
alarm . She denied ever seeing Supervisor F push Youth S’ head
against a wall. She denied hearing Supervisor F say Youth S
stank, but she did hear other female staff suggest she get in the
6

shower. She denied hearing Supervisor F say Youth S was a slow
ass kid and she did see him get her the inhaler.
I interviewed Team Leader O on 6/7/23 face to face at the facility
with the Government Worker. He reported he has been a team
leader for the past 5 years. He reported he came to DeRoy
responding to assistance being needed. When he arrived, he
reported Youth S had a pen and wouldn’t give it up and Youth S
was cussing at everyone, was refusing to do many things asked of
her and had pulled the fire alarm. Team Leader O reported Youth
S attempted to self-harm by placing something around her neck
and she placed something inside her shirt that she had attempted
to self-harm with. He reported staff took away the item she put
around her neck and he and Supervisor F restrained Youth S
while a female staff removed the item in her shirt. Youth S was
throwing cards and pieces from a game and was tearing up books
that staff all ignored. Team Leader O denied hearing Youth S say
she wanted to kill herself, he didn’t see her ingest anything, and
didn’t see her throw water/spit on Supervisor F. Team Leader O
reported Youth S calmed, and he left.
I interviewed Nurse H on 6/7/23 at the facility face to face with the
Government Worker. Nurse H reported on 5/26/23 she was in the
midst of several crises in more than one building. She was called
to DeRoy and was driven there, and she ran inside and found
Youth S lying on the floor by her room in the hallway breathing
fast and saying, “I can’t, I can’t” and was crying. Nurse H reported
she asked Youth S can you breathe, are you having any pain and
what hurts. Nurse H reported she could tell she was getting
oxygen and was breathing hard. Nurse H reported she sat on the
floor with Youth S until the ambulance came (approximately 10
minutes). Nurse H reported she was informed that the hospital
was admitting her, and she was not working the day Youth S
returned.
I interviewed Nurse T face to face at the facility on 6/7/23 with the
Government Worker. Nurse T was not there when Youth S
ingested the solution but was called the evening she returned from
the hospital. She reported she was called when Youth S was
destroying property and was hyperventilating. Nurse T indicated
she heard that Youth S picked up sanitizer but did not ingest it and
she was told that Youth S had superficial cuts from self-harming.
She was not told about the item she put around her neck. Nurse T
reported if she had known the youth had put something around
her neck and said she wanted to die she would have had them
call the psychiatrist. Nurse T reported she instructed the staff to
7

give Youth S her inhaler and to call her back in 10 minutes if
Youth S got worse or not better. Nurse T indicated the fire alarm
was also ringing in the background.
I interviewed Youth S’ therapist on 6/7/23 face to face at the
facility with the Government worker. The Therapist reported she
was aware Youth S had ingested cleaning solution. On 5/31 when
Youth S returned from the hospital the Therapist was on vacation
but took the call from the facility that evening. The Therapist
spoke with Youth S for about 15-20 minutes. She reported Youth
S was crying and escalated and it was difficult to understand her.
The Therapist reported she consulted with the Psychiatrist and the
Clinical Director, and they placed Youth S on 100% supervision.
The therapist reported her recommendation was that Youth S be
taken to Children’s Hospital as she felt she kept “upping the anti”
that evening and was not going to stop at anything. The
psychiatric and clinical director overruled her recommendation and
placed her on 100% supervision. The Therapist reported it was
her understanding that Youth S’ recommendation was for in
patient when she was at the hospital, and she was in the ER for
four days and her packet for inpatient was sent out but there were
no beds. The therapist reported she recently did a screen on
Youth S, and she was negative for suicide, and she was taken off
100% and she is slowly stepping down to less supervision.
I interviewed Supervisor F on 6/7/23 face to face at the facility with
the Government Worker. He reported on 5/26/23 right after
arriving Youth M reported Youth S had drank cleaning solution. He
reported Youth S was on the floor holding her throat saying it was
burning. Supervisor F asked Youth M to show him what bottle she
drank, and he took it and called poison control and had Youth
Worker D stay with Youth S and he told Supervisor B who called
911 and the Nurse. He reported they gave Youth S a cup of water
as directed by poison control and EMS came and transported
Youth S to the hospital.
Supervisor F reported he picked up Youth S from the hospital on
5/31/23. He reported he and Youth Worker C picked up Youth S
from the hospital and arrived on campus about 8:16pm. Youth S
attempted to run when she was let out of the car and Supervisor F
said he grabbed Youth S’ arm and Youth Worker C grabbed an
arm and her waist to stop her from running. Supervisor F reported
they cannot restrain a youth from AWOL but when they are
threatening suicide they can intervene. He reported they were
afraid as Youth S had reported she was going to run in front of a
car. Supervisor F reported they restrained Youth S outside twice
8

during the escort inside for her to calm. Once they got inside, they
let Youth S go. He reported Youth S started kicking, fighting,
punching, pacing, swearing and tearing up stuff. Supervisor F
reported Youth S punched Youth Worker J and she punched him.
Supervisor F reported he and Youth Worker J restrained Youth S
again briefly and then let her go. He reported Youth S was asking
for water and continued to be escalated and was asked to calm
before giving her water. Youth S then yanked open the staff door
and a campus clear was then called. Youth S was reportedly
throwing chairs, flipping over computer desks, and tables.
Supervisor F reported Youth M was standing in front of Youth S
saying to staff “don’t touch her“ during most of the evening.
When the campus clear was called additional staff came to DeRoy
to assist. Youth Worker P and Team Leader O came to the unit.
Supervisor F reported Youth S continued to be aggressive and
pulled down the shade pole from the wall and he immediately took
it from her. He reported Youth S then found metal pieces on the
ground from the shade being ripped out and attempted to self-
harm her wrist with it. He reported Youth S placed a piece down
her shirt, and she had to be restrained to have it removed from her
shirt by a female staff. Supervisor F reported Youth S continued to
be destructive and started hyperventilating so Supervisor F called
the nurse and was instructed to give Youth S her inhaler which
they did. He reported Youth S took 4 puffs of her inhaler after
being instructed to take 2 and she was given water. He reported
Nurse T suggest having her take her medication, but Youth S
refused.
Supervisor F reported Youth S was being provided a lot of
redirections but continued to be destructive and then threw her
cup of water with spit in it on him. Supervisor F denied that Youth
S drank sanitizer, that he called her any names or said she
smelled bad or was a slow ass kid. Supervisor F indicated he
could not swap out with another staff due to being staffed with
only women that evening and Team Leader O had already left.
Supervisor F reported that he never hit Youth S head or face
against the wall.
I interviewed Supervisor B on 6/7/23 face to face at the facility with
the Government Worker. She reported she has worked at Vista for
the past 18 years. She reported she was told by Supervisor F
when Youth S drank the cleaning solution, and she called the
nurse and EMS and then went outside to direct the ambulance.
Supervisor B was not working the night Youth S returned.
9

I interviewed Youth Worker CD face to face at the facility on
6/7/23 with the Government Worker. She reported she came over
to DeRoy from Freedom when the campus clear was called. She
reported when she arrived at DeRoy Youth S was sitting on a
table and was very upset and told Youth Worker CD she didn’t
want to be here. Youth Worker CD reported they talked about
ways to handle anger and she was able to talk Youth S into taking
her medication and a shower. Youth Worker CD reported she
never heard anyone say Youth S smelled but she could smell her.
Youth Worker CD never saw Youth S restrained, and she did not
see any marks or bruises on Youth S. She did not hear Youth S
say she wanted to hurt herself and she was not there when the
fire alarms were pulled/ringing.
I interviewed Youth Worker P on 6/7/23 face to face at the facility
with the Government Worker. She has been employed at Vista for
two years. She came over to DeRoy from Freedom where she
typically works for the campus clear that was called. She reported
Youth S had torn up paper and thrown items and she helped clean
up the mess.
I interviewed Youth D on 6/21/23 face to face at the facility with
the Government Worker. Youth D is 14 years old and is going into
the 9th grade. Youth D and Youth S reside on the same wing in
DeRoy. Youth D reported that she drank a cleaning solution from
the towel closet two days after Youth S as she wanted to kill
herself. She reported there are two closets on the wing, the
chemical closet and the towel closed. The chemical closet is
where Youth S got the cleaning solution to drink, and Youth D got
the cleaning solution from the towel closet where extra unopened
cleaning fluid is kept. Both closets are supposed to be kept
locked at all times. Youth D denied that anyone told her to ingest
cleaning solution and that she did not have a pact with other youth
to drink cleaning solution. Youth D reported drinking cleaning
solution is one of the only ways to try and kill yourself at Vista
besides self-harm. Youth D reported she wanted to die and
wanted to “cease to exist” during the interview. The Government
Worker indicated to Vista staff that Youth D needed to be taken to
Children’s Hospital for suicidal ideation following the interview.
Youth D is currently in the hospital at Kingswood for suicidal
ideation.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer on 6/21/23 who reviewed
video and reported that no one checked the closet on 5/26/23
from midnight forward leaving it open the day when Youth S got
access to cleaning solution and drank it. On 5/28/23 the linen
10

closet was left open during/after chores were completed. He
reported the cleaning solutions Vista uses are nontoxic and can
make one feel sick but are not lethal if ingested.
Video:
5/26/23 6:04pm Youth S goes to the supply closed and opens the
door and grabs a bottle of cleaner and takes it to her room.
6:06pm Youth M goes down the hall to Youth S’ room and then
comes out with a bottle of cleaning solution and puts it away in the
closet and then goes down hallway. Youth S can be seen at the
end of the hallway in front of her bedroom door coughing and
grabbing at her throat. She is laying on the floor flopping around.
Supervisor F and Youth Worker D come into the video and
Supervisor F is getting the bottle of solution and Youth M is
assisting him with knowing which bottle. Youth Worker D is
tending to Youth S who continues to be on the floor.
Video 5/28/23 DeRoy wing 6:36pm. Supervisor F is observed
opening the cleaning supply closet and the towel closet and
propping them open and pouring cleaning solution into a mop
bucket. 7pm Youth D gets towels from the closet. 7:02 pm Youth
D picks up a bottle of cleaner in the towel closet and reads it and
puts it back down. 7:05 Youth D is standing in front of the two
open closets and staff comes and closes and locks the cleaning
supply closet. Youth D is seen trying to open the door to the
cleaning closet after the staff member leaves. 7:06pm Youth D
goes and stands by the towel closet and is pacing and then goes
into the towel closet and takes a bottle of cleaner and goes down
the hall and into a room with it. She then comes out and sweeps
the hallway. 7:28pm she goes to her room. 7:31pm Youth M
goes to Youth D’s room and then comes out and heads down the
hallway. 7:33pm staff come and get the cleaning fluid bottle and
put it away and lock the closet. Youth D is seen at the far end of
the hallway on the floor.
Documentation Review:
Incident report dated 5/26/23 authored by Youth Worker D -
report consistent with all staff reports when Youth S ingested the
cleaning solution.
Incident report dated 5/28/23 no author is identified on the report.
Report indicated Youth D drank cleaning fluid she obtained from
the towel closet at 7:35pm. EMS and poison control were called.
EMS arrived at 7:47pm and Youth D was taken to the hospital for
observation.
11

Suicide Prevention Policy-in event of a suicide threat or attempt
the shift supervisor must seek immediately medical attention.
Client risk evaluation will be performed followed by a safety plan
of action.
Suicide Risk Assessment Tool for Residential Youth. Check box
assessment tool to use when youth are suicidal.
Client Supervision Policy-clients on all units are to be
continually supervised. The supervisor or team leader will
complete the appropriate sections of the afternoon and midnight
shift security checklist form and submit it to the building manager.
Unit Security checks policy-at the beginning of each shift the
shift supervisor or designee should complete a security check with
the departing supervisor or designee. Security checks are
conducted to ensure all items and unit areas are secured.
Security Check instructions-shift supervisor is responsible to
ensure all closets (JC, supply, linen, etc.) should be locked.
Analysis Based upon interviews and video review there is evidence that
supports staff were not able to provide for the needs, protection
and supervision of residents. Youth S ingested chemical cleaning
solution on 5/26/23 from an unlocked cleaning product closet that
is required to be secured when not in use. The closet was closed
but the door was not locked, and Youth S opens the door and
removes the chemical without anyone seeing her.
On 5/28/23 Youth D was able to access and ingest chemical
cleaning solution from the towel closet that is also supposed to be
locked when not in use. Youth D removed the bottle of
chemical/solution from the open closed and there is no staff
supervising to see her take the bottle and then ingest it.
The facility is in violation of their security check policy as the doors
were not checked at shift change to ensure they were locked.
The facility is in violation of their client supervision policy as two
youth were able to locate and ingest cleaning solution without staff
being aware.
Conclusion Violation Established
12

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
(d) Restraining youth to fixed objects, including beds or walls.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth S was restrained against a wall.
Investigation Youth S reported she was restrained by Supervisor F against a
wall resulting in her head being slammed up against the wall.
Several staff were interviewed that were working and involved in
the restraint who reported they did not see Youth S’ head hit
against the wall.
Video Review:
5/31/23 Youth S is returned to the unit. Supervisor F and Youth
Worker C come through the doors at 8:19pm escorting Youth S
into the building. Once inside the building they let her go. Youth S
is very escalated and is throwing things, knocking over furniture, is
getting in Supervisor F’s face yelling, and then punches him twice
in the chest. 8:22pm Supervisor F grabs Youth S’ hand and arm
and puts her up against the wall after he is assaulted by Youth S.
Youth S’ head hits the wall from the force of the restraint and the
